com.norconex.collector.http.sitemap.impl

Class StandardSitemapResolverFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.norconex.collector.http.sitemap.impl.StandardSitemapResolverFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISitemapResolverFactory, IXMLConfigurable

    public class StandardSitemapResolverFactory
extends Object
implements ISitemapResolverFactory, IXMLConfigurable

    Factory used to created StandardSitemapResolver instances. Refer to StandardSitemapResolver for resolution logic.

    XML configuration usage:

      <sitemapResolverFactory ignore="[false|true]" lenient="[false|true]" 
     class="com.norconex.collector.http.sitemap.impl.StandardSitemapResolverFactory">
     <tempDir>(where to store temp files)</tempDir>
     <path>
       (Optional path relative to URL root for a sitemap. Use a single empty
        "path" tag to rely instead on any sitemaps specified as start URLs or
        defined in robots.txt, if enabled.  Not specifying any path tags
        falls back to trying to locate sitemaps using default paths.)
     </path>
     (... repeat path tag as needed ...)
  </sitemapResolverFactory>

    Usage example:

    The following ignores sitemap files present on web sites. 

      <sitemapResolverFactory ignore="true"/>
    Author:
    Pascal Essiembre
    See Also:
    StandardSitemapResolver

      • getSitemapPaths

        public String[] getSitemapPaths()
        Gets the URL paths, relative to the URL root, from which to try locate and resolve sitemaps. Default paths are "/sitemap.xml" and "/sitemap-index.xml".
        Returns:
        sitemap paths.
        Since:
        2.3.0

      • getTempDir

        public File getTempDir()
        Gets the directory where sitemap files are temporary stored before they are parsed. When null (default), temporary files are created directly under AbstractCrawlerConfig.getWorkDir(). the crawler working directory is also undefined, it will use the system temporary directory, as returned by FileUtils.getTempDirectory().
        Returns:
        directory where temporary files are written
        Since:
        2.3.0

      • setTempDir

        public void setTempDir(File tempDir)

        Parameters:

        Since:
        2.3.0
